channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bond investors are trimming ‘Magnificent Seven’ holdings — with one exception
item.description: Corporate bond investors have been trimming their holdings of bonds issued by the “Magnificent Seven,” with one exception, since the November presiden...

item.title: Behind MicroStrategy's Bitcoin Bet: Investors Who Usually Play It Safe
item.description: “Bitcoin bonds” offer insurers a less risky way to purchase cryptocurrency.

item.title: Dollar Likely to Remain Firm in Near Term
item.description: The WSJ dollar index was little changed and was seen likely to remain elevated in the first half of the year before gradually falling.

item.title: Gold Futures Slip But Stay Close to Highs on Safe-Haven Demand
item.description: Gold futures fall, though they sit higher on-week on safe-haven demand. Futures are down 0.3% at $2,763.50 a troy ounce.

item.title: Why some hope the IRS’s free tax-prep program becomes the next Obamacare
item.description: The longer the Direct File tax-prep program sticks around, the harder it is to end it, critics worry.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Inventories Fall Less Than Expected
item.description: U.S. natural gas supplies fell by 223 billion cubic feet last week to 2,892 billion cubic feet, reducing surplus inventories.

item.title: American Airlines’ weaker-than-expected guidance ‘not as negative’ as it appeared, says analyst
item.description: American Airlines cited “present demand trends” and fuel-price forecasts as it predicted a first-quarter loss.

item.title: Oil turns lower as traders assess Trump tariff threats, efforts to lower crude prices
item.description: Oil futures turned lower Thursday after President Donald Trump said he would ask Saudi Arabia and OPEC to lower oil prices, implying that he would pre...

item.title: Trump tells Davos he’ll demand that interest rates drop. It’s a fresh jab at the Fed.
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump delivered remarks Thursday in a video appearance at the World Economic Forum’s annual gathering in Davos, Switzerland.

item.title: U.S. Stock Indexes Try to Balance Trump Tariff Threats, AI Enthusiasm
item.description: The S&P 500 edged higher. The Nasdaq Composite slipped, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average advanced. President Trump told business leaders to make...
